intro: Corydalis solida f. digitata, commonly known as the digitate corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces slender, branching stems and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan.
